instructions.step: Assembly Instructions
Step 1: Locate the bottom casing of the coffee machine.
Step 2: Carefully place the rubber sealing ring into the designated groove in the bottom casing. Ensure it sits flush and is not twisted.
Step 3: Position the bottom plate over the rubber ring, aligning any screw holes. Press down gently to secure the ring and the plate within the bottom casing.
Step 4: Use the provided screws to fix the bottom plate to the bottom casing. Tighten the screws evenly, but do not overtighten.
Heating Element And Electronics Assembly

Step 5: This step involves connecting the heating element to the electronic components. Refer to the detailed diagram in the user manual for the correct wiring connections. (This step is not intended for video demonstration).
Step 6: Attach the rubber tubes to the inlet and outlet connections of the heating element. Ensure a snug fit to prevent leaks.
Water Tank and Tubing Installation
Step 7: Place the water tank onto the designated area on the base of the coffee machine. Align any mounting points.
Step 8: Secure the water tank by tightening the retaining screw(s) if present.
Step 9: Connect the other ends of the rubber tubes from the heating element to the corresponding inlets on the water tank. Pay attention to which tube connects to which port.

Step 10: Route the rubber tubes neatly and place them onto the bottom plate, ensuring they are not pinched or kinked. Secure them with clips or guides if provided, and screw down the bottom plate firmly.
Step 11: Insert the long intake tube vertically into the middle opening within the water tank.
Step 12: Place the water path assembly on top of the long intake tube and clip it securely onto the surface of the water tank.
Filter and Cover Installation
Step 13: Place the coffee filter (permanent or paper) into the filter holder.
Step 14: Position the filter holder assembly onto the water tank.
Step 15: Carefully place the top cover of the coffee machine into position and snap it into place.
Step 16: Add the water tank lid/cover to the water tank opening.
Brewing Your First Cup
Step 17: Add your desired amount of coffee grounds to the filter.
Step 18: Fill the water tank with fresh water.
Step 19: Close all covers and ensure they are properly sealed.
Step 20: Plug the coffee maker into a power outlet.
Step 21: Press the brew button and wait for your coffee to be ready.
Step 22: Enjoy your freshly brewed coffee!

Repair: Heating Element Replacement Step 1: ENSURE THE COFFEE MACHINE IS UNPLUGGED FROM THE POWER OUTLET AND HAS COOLED DOWN COMPLETELY. Step 2: Empty the water tank and remove any residual water. Step 3: Remove the casing as described in the pump replacement instructions. Step 4: Locate the heating element. It is typically a metal component with electrical connections and tube connections. Step 5: Disconnect the rubber tubes connected to the heating element. Step 6: Disconnect the electrical connections to the heating element. Take a photo or make a diagram of the wiring before disconnecting. Step 7: Remove the heating element from its mounting. Step 8: Install the new heating element in the reverse order: Mount the new heating element, reconnect electrical connections (referencing your diagram/photo), and reattach the rubber tubes. Step 9: Reassemble the casing. Step 10: Test the coffee machine with water to check for leaks and proper heating.
